overview_summary: Neither of the two profiled neighbors has made a public stance on the development, leaving both classified as "unknown" in their support or opposition. Both landowners appear to have limited formal roles or public engagement, meaning the cohort includes no high-influence community figures (both are low-influence local residents).

neighbors.name: Barry L & Alicia M Wirth
neighbors.claims: Barry L. Wirth and Alicia M. Wirth jointly own multiple rural land parcels in Barron County, Wisconsin ([gcswebportal.co.barron.wi.us](https://gcswebportal.co.barron.wi.us/Search.aspx?ParcelNumber=012310029010#:~:text=No%20Property%20Addresses%20were%20found)). No records were found of the Wirths holding public office or making statements on local development issues ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/569167773-who-were-the-indefinitely-confined-voters-in-barron-county#:~:text=No%20,wirth)). Barron County has emphasized farmland preservation since 1979 ([www.barroncountywi.gov](https://www.barroncountywi.gov/index.asp?DE=DA744D5F-9BCC-4150-81FC-9F75BB477217&SEC=5849F663-F197-46AF-9020-7123068F82DF#:~:text=WI%20www,Working%20Lands%20Initiative%20became%20state)), suggesting that landowners like the Wirths prioritize agricultural use of their property.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via a fellow local farmer to discuss how the project will protect long-term soil health and preserve farmland use, directly addressing any concerns about erosion or runoff.

neighbors.name: Ian R Thompson
neighbors.claims: Ian R. Thompson is listed as the owner of multiple land parcels in Barron County’s property records ([gcswebportal.co.barron.wi.us](https://gcswebportal.co.barron.wi.us/Search.aspx?ParcelNumber=012310029010#:~:text=No%20Property%20Addresses%20were%20found)). While other Thompson family members appear in local listings (e.g., a Kearney N. Thompson in Dallas) ([northwoodsreporter.com](https://northwoodsreporter.com/stories/569167773-who-were-the-indefinitely-confined-voters-in-barron-county#:~:text=Kearney%20Nell%20Thompson%20%20,09%2F18%2F2020)), no public references specifically to Ian R. Thompson were found in news or civic archives. Barron County’s longstanding farmland preservation program ([www.barroncountywi.gov](https://www.barroncountywi.gov/index.asp?DE=DA744D5F-9BCC-4150-81FC-9F75BB477217&SEC=5849F663-F197-46AF-9020-7123068F82DF#:~:text=WI%20www,Working%20Lands%20Initiative%20became%20state)) indicates that local landowners like Thompson tend to be mindful of keeping land in agricultural use.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community agriculture liaison reach out to highlight how the development plans include soil conservation measures and eventual land restoration, addressing typical farming community concerns about preserving productive land.
